p: An increasing body of evidence points that electroacupuncture (EA) may provide modest benefits in the treatment of CINV. [ 13] However, the spread of it is surprisingly slow, and EA is still judged as a highly suggestive but not conclusive treatment. [ 14â€“ 17] For certain patients, they are reluctant to accept EA treatment for their intolerance to needling. The problems and limits of EA center on how it manipulate. Thus, auricular acupuncture (AA) might be a sound treatment to feather all patients' needs for convenience and comfort. Compared with a pile of studies conducted the access to the effectiveness of EA against CINV, the role of AA has received less attention, [ 18] and the literatures on AA are limited in number with uncertain quality.
